title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 28.9 - Costs of hearings; stenographic record
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 28.9 - Costs of hearings; stenographic record

State Regulations
(a) Witness fees shall be the same as in
the court in which the action was commenced or, if the action was transferred, the court to which the action was transferred and the costs shall be borne by
the same parties as in court. (b) The panel shall not be required to
cause a stenographic record to be made, but if any party, at least five days
before the hearing, requests such record be kept and deposits $50 or such
additional sum as the panel may fix to secure payment therefor, the panel shall
provide a stenographer. Any surplus deposited shall be returned to the party
depositing it. The cost of the stenographer shall not be a taxable
disbursement. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
28.9

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
